page.title: 03BIBURY AREA:FIELD BOUNDARIES
page.content: The main field boundaries are Cotswold drystone walls or hedgerows.The stone for the walls came originally from the small local quarries that are now no longer in use.Some of the walls are in a poor state of repair because of the time,costs and labour required for rebuilding. The hedgerows contain mainly hawthorn,elderberry,maple,ash and blackthorn.Most of the hedgerows have been layered in the past to make them stockproof and some farmers in the area still layer them regularly.Today the hedgerows are kept tidy by winter cutting by tractor driven hedge cutters. The number of tree species in a 30 metre length of hedge gives an idea of the age of the hedgerow.Most of the hedgerows studied in the area were between 500-700 years old.
